headline: Why US Utility Stocks Are Falling After the AI Power Surge
summary: Companies that recently hit record valuations are returning to earth as investors realize the massive data-center deals they’d banked on are actually smaller, or slower, than expected.  Constellation Energy Corp. saw shares tumble 11% from an October high after a third-quarter earnings call that yielded no details on new power generation.  The headline of one Jefferies analyst note read: “No Data Center Deals.”

headline: Why Constellation Energy (CEG) Is Up 6.2% After Landmark DOE Loan and Calpine Deal News
summary: In November 2025, Constellation Energy announced senior leadership changes, the onboarding of Calpine executives, and a $1 billion US Department of Energy loan for the Crane Clean Energy Center, supporting progress on the Calpine transaction and clean energy investments. An interesting insight is that the DOE loan represents the first time a conditional loan commitment and financial close were finalized together, reflecting external confidence in Constellation's financial health and vital...
